alert.note: Alert for Butler; Conecuh; Covington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 27 at 9:50AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Butler, east central Conecuh and northwestern Covington Counties through 1030 AM CDT... At 950 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles north of I65 And US 84, or 5 miles northwest of Evergreen, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Evergreen, McKenzie, River Falls, Red Level and I65 And US 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
